title: Epic: Task-based delegation extension for pi
description:
Replace persona-based subagent extension with task-based delegation system.

## Goals
1. Task types with minimal contracts (policy, not persona)
2. Difficulty-based model selection (small/medium/large)
3. Skill injection into workers
4. Session continuation via session_id
5. No sandbox policies (for now)
6. No personas - workers execute WHAT, not WHO they are

## Architecture
- **Task Type**: Policy (model, tools, thinking) + default skills
- **Skill**: Injectable knowledge from ~/.pi/agent/skills/ or .pi/skills/
- **Task Session**: Durable transcript, resumable via session_id
- **Worker**: Executes task with context prompt (not identity persona)

## Built-in Task Types
- code: General implementation work
- search: Find code, definitions, references (read-only tools)
- review: Code review with review skill
- planning: Architecture and design decisions
- general: User-specified skills

## Config (settings.json)
```json
{
  "tasks": {
    "code": {
      "difficulty": {
        "small": { "model": "anthropic/claude-haiku-4" },
        "medium": { "model": "anthropic/claude-sonnet-4" },
        "large": { "model": "anthropic/claude-sonnet-4", "thinking": "high" }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## DoD
- New extension in tau/extensions/task/
- Old subagent extension removed from ~/.pi
- task tool registered and working
- Skill injection functional
- Session continuation working
- Custom TUI rendering for task results
close_reason: Implemented task-based delegation extension and removed old subagent

title: Create extension scaffold: tau/extensions/task/
description:
Create the basic extension structure.

## Files to create
```
tau/extensions/task/
├── package.json          # Extension manifest with pi.extensions
└── src/
    ├── index.ts          # Extension entry point
    └── types.ts          # TypeScript interfaces
```

## package.json structure
```json
{
  "name": "task",
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "pi": {
    "extensions": ["./src/index.ts"]
  }
}
```

## index.ts minimal scaffold
- Import ExtensionAPI from @mariozechner/pi-coding-agent
- Export default function that takes pi: ExtensionAPI
- Log 'task extension loaded' on session_start

## DoD
- Extension loads without errors when pi starts
- session_start event fires and logs message
close_reason: Created extensions/task scaffold

title: Create review skill from old review agent
description:
Migrate review agent content to a proper skill.

## Source
Check ~/.pi/agent/extensions/subagent/agents/ or ~/.pi/agent/agents/ for review.md

## Target
~/.pi/agent/skills/review/SKILL.md

## Skill format
```markdown
---
name: review
description: Code review guidelines and output format
---

# Code Review Skill

{extracted guidelines from old review.md}

## Output Format
{any structured output requirements}
```

## Key content to preserve
- Review process guidelines
- What to look for (bugs, security, style)
- Output format/structure expectations

## What to remove
- Identity prompts ('You are a code reviewer...')
- Persona language
- Redundant instructions covered by task context

## DoD
- review skill exists at correct path
- loadSkill('review', cwd) returns content
- No persona language in skill content
close_reason: Migrated review agent into review skill (plus planning/search skills)

title: Implement TaskRegistry: load built-in + user config
close_reason: Implemented TaskRegistry with config overrides and difficulty resolution

title: Implement SkillLoader: load skills from disk
description:
Create SkillLoader that finds and loads skill content.

## File: src/skills.ts

## LoadedSkill interface
```typescript
interface LoadedSkill {
  name: string;
  path: string;
  contents: string;
}
```

## Search paths (in order of priority)
1. .pi/skills/{name}/SKILL.md (project-local)
2. .pi/skills/{name}.md
3. ~/.pi/agent/skills/{name}/SKILL.md (user)
4. ~/.pi/agent/skills/{name}.md

## API
- loadSkill(name: string, cwd: string): LoadedSkill | null
- loadSkills(names: string[], cwd: string): { loaded: LoadedSkill[], missing: string[] }

## DoD
- Can load beads skill from ~/.pi/agent/skills/beads/SKILL.md
- Project-local skills take precedence
- Returns null for missing skills without throwing
close_reason: Implemented SkillLoader with project/user lookup

title: Implement SessionManager: track active task sessions
description:
Create SessionManager for session continuation.

## File: src/sessions.ts

## TaskSession interface
```typescript
interface TaskSession {
  sessionId: string;
  taskType: string;
  difficulty: Difficulty;
  process: ChildProcess;       // spawned pi process
  createdAt: number;
}
```

## In-memory storage
- Map<sessionId, TaskSession>
- Sessions live for duration of parent pi process

## API
- getSession(sessionId): TaskSession | undefined
- createSession(taskType, difficulty): TaskSession
- hasSession(sessionId): boolean

## Session ID generation
- Use crypto.randomUUID() for new sessions
- Accept existing sessionId for continuation

## DoD
- Can create new session and retrieve by ID
- Can detect session_id mismatch (wrong task_type)
- Sessions survive across multiple task tool calls
close_reason: Implemented SessionManager for task session tracking

title: Implement TaskRunner: spawn and stream pi processes
description:
Create TaskRunner that spawns worker pi processes.

## File: src/runner.ts

## Core responsibilities
1. Build worker system prompt (context, not persona)
2. Spawn pi process with correct flags
3. Stream JSON events back to parent
4. Handle completion/error/interruption

## Worker system prompt structure
```
# Task Execution Context
You are executing a delegated task from parent session: {parentSessionId}

## Guidelines
- Focus on the requested task
- Use available tools as needed
- If specific output format required, follow it exactly
- Otherwise, summarize what you did and why

{parallel_constraints if parallelCount > 1}

---
<skill name="{name}" path="{path}">
{skill contents}
</skill>
```

## pi spawn arguments
```bash
pi --mode json -p --no-session \
  --model {resolvedModel} \
  --thinking {resolvedThinking} \
  --tools {toolsList} \
  --append-system-prompt {tempPromptFile} \
  "Task: {userPrompt}"
```

## Event processing
- Parse NDJSON from stdout
- Emit updates via onUpdate callback
- Accumulate messages for final result
- Track usage stats (tokens, cost)

## TaskResult
```typescript
type TaskOutput =
  | { type: 'completed'; message: string }
  | { type: 'completed_tool'; toolOutput: string }
  | { type: 'completed_empty' }
  | { type: 'interrupted'; resumable: true }
  | { type: 'failed'; reason: string; resumable: boolean };

interface TaskResult {
  output: TaskOutput;
  sessionId: string;
  usage: UsageStats;
}
```

## DoD
- Can spawn pi process and capture output
- Streams progress to parent via onUpdate
- Handles all termination cases (success, error, abort)
- Cleans up temp files on completion
close_reason: Implemented TaskRunner to spawn pi workers and stream NDJSON

title: Register task tool with pi.registerTool()

title: Implement custom TUI rendering for task results
description:
Add custom renderCall and renderResult for nice TUI display.

## File: src/render.ts

## renderCall display
Show task being delegated:
```
• task review:medium
  └ "Review changes in src/foo.rs"
```

## renderResult display (collapsed)
```
✓ task review:medium (session: abc-123)
  └ 3 turns ↑1.2k ↓800 $0.0042 anthropic/claude-sonnet-4
  └ Found 2 issues: missing error handling, unused import
```

## renderResult display (expanded)
Show full message content with markdown rendering.

## Streaming display (isPartial)
```
⏳ task review:medium (running...)
  └ read src/foo.rs
  └ grep "error" ./
  └ ...
```

## Status indicators
- ⏳ Running (blinking dot like current subagent)
- ✓ Completed (green)
- ✗ Failed (red)
- ⚠ Interrupted (yellow)

## DoD
- renderCall shows task_type:difficulty and description
- renderResult shows completion status and summary
- Streaming updates show tool calls as they happen
- Expanded view shows full output with markdown
close_reason: Added custom TUI rendering for task call/result

title: Add parallel worker detection and constraints
description:
Detect when multiple task calls are in same parent turn.

## Purpose
When LLM calls task() multiple times in parallel, inject constraints to prevent conflicts.

## Detection
- Track task tool invocations per parent turn
- Count concurrent workers spawned

## Parallel constraints prompt (injected when parallelCount > 1)
```
## Parallel Execution ({parallelCount} workers)
This parent spawned {parallelCount} task sessions in parallel.
- Assume other workers may be editing the repo at the same time.
- Avoid editing the same files or shared contracts unless explicitly required.
- Keep changes narrowly scoped to your assigned area.
- If you detect overlap or a dependency on another worker, stop and report it.
```

## Implementation
- Use atomic counter per turn context
- Increment on each task tool call
- Finalize count before spawning any workers
- Inject constraints if count > 1

## DoD
- Single task call: no parallel constraints injected
- Multiple parallel calls: all workers see constraint prompt
- Count is accurate even with concurrent calls
close_reason: Added parallel worker detection and constraint prompt injection

title: Error when task type config references non-existent tools
description:
Currently, if a task type config specifies tools that don't exist (e.g. tools: ["read", "nonexistent_tool"]), the non-existent tools are silently ignored.

This is a bug because:
1. User expects the tools they configure to be available
2. Typos in tool names go unnoticed (e.g. "grepp" instead of "grep")
3. Makes debugging config issues difficult

Expected behavior:
- On TaskRegistry.load(), validate that all tools in task type configs exist
- Produce clear error or warning listing unknown tools
- Either fail fast or log warning at startup

Affected code:
- extensions/task/src/registry.ts - normalizeTaskType() or load()
- Need access to list of available tools to validate against

title: Skill resolution fallback: global path then extension-bundled
description:
Skills for builtin task types (code, search, review, planning) should be bundled with the task extension, not require users to install them globally.

Current behavior:
- Skills are discovered from global paths only (~/.pi/agent/skills/, ~/.codex/skills/, etc.)
- Builtin task types reference skills (e.g. search type has skills: ["search"])
- If user doesn't have these skills installed globally, they're missing

Expected behavior:
1. First check normal skill discovery path (user/global skills)
2. If not found, fallback to extension-bundled skills (extensions/task/skills/)
3. User skills override extension-bundled skills (allows customization)

This allows:
- Task extension to ship with working default skills
- Users to override with their own versions
- No manual skill installation required for builtins

Bundled skills location: extensions/task/skills/
- code/SKILL.md
- search/SKILL.md
- review/SKILL.md
- planning/SKILL.md
- task-delegation/SKILL.md
- task-type-creation/SKILL.md

title: Epic: In-process task workers (no pi subprocess)
description: Replace TaskRunner's child_process.spawn('pi') worker execution with in-process AgentSession workers using the pi SDK (createAgentSession).nnGoalsn- No OS subprocess spawning for workersn- Keep session_id continuation (workers persistent across multiple task calls)n- Tools per worker/task come from TaskRegistry policy (strict allowlist)n- Preserve streaming updates + usage + TUI renderingn- Support nested task spawning in a single process (task tool available inside workers, per config)nnOut of scope (for now)n- Global tool locking / concurrency controlsnnDoDn- No remaining spawn('pi') usage in extensions/taskn- Manual validation: task tool runs a worker and returns output + session_id; session_id reuse continues contextn- Manual validation: nested task calls render reasonably
close_reason: In-process worker backend implemented; subprocess removed; test checklist recorded

title: Investigate SDK worker sessions via createAgentSession
description: Map feasibility of running delegated workers in-process using the pi SDK.nnScopen- Read /home/ribelo/projects/ribelo/pi-mono/packages/coding-agent/src/core/sdk.ts createAgentSession()n- Identify minimal CreateAgentSessionOptions needed for a headless worker (no extension discovery, controlled tools, controlled skills)n- Identify how to stream progress (AgentSession.subscribe events) and extract: tool calls, tool results, assistant text, usage, costnnFindingsn- createAgentSession(options) supports in-process AgentSession creation with custom tools/extensions and SessionManager.inMemory().n- AgentSession exposes tool APIs: getAllTools(), getActiveToolNames(), setActiveToolsByName(toolNames). setActiveToolsByName rebuilds system prompt with selected tools (supports built-in + extension tools if loaded).n- Tools selection: createAgentSession.tools affects built-in tools only; extension tools are registered via extension loading. To allow extension tools while enforcing allowlist, load needed extension factories (or allow discovery) then call session.setActiveToolsByName(allowedToolNames).n- Skills: set options.skills = [] to disable auto skill injection; continue appending worker skill content manually (same as current --no-skills + append-system-prompt behavior).n- System prompt: use options.systemPrompt = (defaultPrompt) => `${defaultPrompt}nn${workerPrompt}` to preserve default prompt + AGENTS.md context and append worker context/skills.n- Session persistence: keep a Map<session_id, AgentSession> in TaskRunner; construct each worker session with SessionManager.inMemory(cwd) and reuse the same AgentSession object across calls.nnRecommended createAgentSession options for workersn- cwd: parent cwdn- authStorage/modelRegistry: cached singletons from discoverAuthStorage() + discoverModels()n- sessionManager: SessionManager.inMemory(cwd)n- systemPrompt: function to append worker promptn- skills: []n- extensions: [] + inline extension factories for allowed extension tools (task/bd/exa), OR allow discovery then filter tools via setActiveToolsByNamen- tools: optional built-in tool list (but still call setActiveToolsByName for final allowlist)nnEvents to listen to (AgentSession.subscribe)n- tool_execution_start: toolCallId/toolName/args (start activity)n- tool_execution_end: toolCallId/result/isError (mark success/fail, optional result text)n- message_end (assistant): capture usage + last assistant text (turn count)n- message_end (toolResult): capture tool output text for activity previewn- message_update (assistant text_delta) if streaming preview is desirednnDeliverablen- Write a short note (in this issue description or a comment) with recommended createAgentSession() options for workers, including how to keep sessions persistent across calls.nnDoDn- Clear recommended options listn- Confirm which events to listen to for tool execution + message streaming + usage
close_reason: Documented createAgentSession options + event mapping for in-process workers

title: Decide worker tool scope + nested task recursion policy
description: We need one explicit decision before implementation:nnDecisionsn1) TaskRegistry.tools applies to BOTH built-in tools (read/bash/edit/write/ls/find/grep/...) and extension tools (e.g. task/bd/exa).n2) Workers may be allowed to call task (nested delegation) when included/allowed by the tool policy.n3) Default max nesting depth: 3. If exceeded, nested task call should fail fast with a clear error (not spawn).nnDoDn- Decision recorded in this issue (final answers)n- If nesting allowed: define default max depth + failure behavior when exceeded
close_reason: Decisions recorded: tools allow built-in+extension; nested task allowed when permitted; max depth 3

title: Refactor task runner to support pluggable worker backend
description: Prepare extensions/task for swapping the worker execution model.nnScopen- Identify code in extensions/task/src/runner.ts that is specific to child_process.spawn('pi')n- Introduce an internal abstraction (e.g. WorkerBackend) so we can implement InProcessWorkerBackend without rewriting higher-level logicnnDoDn- Clear separation between: (a) worker session orchestration, (b) backend executionn- No behavior changes yet
close_reason: Refactored TaskRunner with WorkerBackend abstraction while keeping subprocess backend}

title: Implement in-process WorkerBackend using createAgentSession
description: Implement worker execution without spawning OS processes.nnScopen- Replace spawn('pi') execution with an in-process AgentSession created by createAgentSession()n- Persist worker sessions in-memory keyed by session_id (reuse same AgentSession object across calls)n- Use SessionManager.inMemory() for worker sessions (no file sessions)n- Build worker system prompt from existing buildWorkerSystemPrompt() + injected skillsnnDoDn- Worker executes prompts successfully without spawning subprocessesn- session_id reuse continues prior worker contextn- No regressions: still returns final output to parent tool
close_reason: Implemented in-process WorkerBackend using createAgentSession and switched TaskRunner to it}

title: Stream worker events into task tool updates (no NDJSON parsing)
description: Replace NDJSON stdout parsing with AgentSession.subscribe() event handling.nnScopen- Subscribe to worker AgentSession eventsn- Maintain TaskRunnerUpdateDetails incrementally:n  - activities list (toolCallId, toolName, args, status)n  - message preview (latest assistant text or latest tool output)n  - usage aggregation (turn count, input/output tokens, cost)n  - durationn- Feed onUpdate() for live TUI renderingnnDoDn- Live updates show tool activity while worker is runningn- Final result includes correct usage + durationn- Handles failure/abort cleanly
close_reason: In-process backend streams AgentSession events into TaskRunner (no NDJSON parsing for default path)}

title: Remove subprocess backend + cleanup task session plumbing
description: Finalize migration away from OS process workers.nnScopen- Delete spawn('pi') code pathn- Remove temp prompt file handling that is no longer neededn- Update extensions/task/src/sessions.ts to reflect in-process sessions (store AgentSession/metadata instead of ChildProcess + sessionFile)n- Ensure nested task delegation still works with new architecture (as per recursion policy)nnDoDn- `rg "spawn(\"pi\"" extensions/task/src` returns no matchesn- Task tool works end-to-end in manual testing
close_reason: Removed subprocess backend and temp session plumbing; sessions now track in-process metadata}

title: Manual test plan + documentation for in-process workers
description: Document how to validate the new worker model.nnTest checklistn1) Simple task run: call task tool with task_type=code and a simple bash echo; verify tool result returns output + session_id.n2) session_id continuation: call task again with same session_id; verify worker remembers prior context (ask it to summarize previous action).n3) Nested task call (if allowed): use task_type that allows task tool; prompt worker to delegate a sub-task; verify nested task renders and completes.n4) Max depth: attempt to nest beyond depth 3; verify task tool fails fast with a clear error.n5) Error handling: invalid task_type should return helpful error; worker failure should surface error text.nnDoDn- Checklist recorded in this issue (this description)}
close_reason: Recorded manual test checklist in issue description}

description:

Currently, if a task type config specifies skills that don't exist, they are silently ignored.
